alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 3:04AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Floyd, southern Walker and Chattooga Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 304 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Cloudland, or 10 miles west of Summerville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Summerville, Trion, Lyerly, Menlo, Subligna, Cloudland, Berryton, Tidings, Armuchee, Everett Springs and James H. Floyd State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
